revised_title: Population Identity and Migratory Destinations of North Atlantic Humpback Whales
tldr: The study analyzed nuclear and mitochondrial loci in skin biopsies from central and northeastern North Atlantic humpback whales to determine their population identity and migratory destinations. The results showed that the whales from the northeastern North Atlantic do not represent a separate breeding population from those in the West Indies, supporting the idea of a common North Atlantic panmictic population.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ecology and Evolution
